SRF has confirmed that the Swiss entry for the Eurovision Song Contest 2021 is set to be released in March.
Switzerland joins an extensive list of countries that will be releasing its entry for the Eurovision Song Contest 2021 in March. SRF confirmed on Twitter this morning that the song will be revealed next month, but the exact date is still to be confirmed.
The Swiss entry for the 2021 contest was selected in December. 13 songs were created at a song camp which were then produced with Gjon recording his vocals on each track.
The songs 13 songs were assessed 100 person viewer panel and a 20 person jury of international specialists, who awarded points and feedback to each of the songs. The songs were then refined based on the feedback with videos of Gjon singing the songs live produced. These videos went back to the jury for final assessment. The winning songs title has not been revealed but it is confirmed that the song has been co-written by Gjon.
